snippet: The withdrawal of foreign troops, aid workers and billions of dollars in assistance has the potential to undo the fragile progress Afghans have made under the occupation.
abstract: Many Afghans fear that withdrawal of foreign troops, aid workers and billions of dollars in assistance may undo the fragile progress they have made under the occupation, or even set off a new round of insecurity and civil unrest; with deadline still two years away, real estate prices, salaries, store sales and factory orders have already begun to shrink.

byline.contributor: Jawad Sukhanyar and Sharifullah Sahak contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The withdrawal of foreign troops, aid workers and billions of dollars in assistance has the potential to undo the fragile progress Afghans have made under the occupation.

headline.seo: Afghans Fear Economic Downturn as Foreigners Leave
headline.main: Afghans Fear Downturn as Foreigners Withdraw
headline.print_headline: Afghans Fear Downturn As Foreigners Withdraw
